Questions.QuestionString: The stall margin is controlled by. (Level 1)
Answers: speed bug cursor.
E.P.R limits.
C. angle of attack and flap position.

Questions.QuestionString: A device used do dump lift from an aircraft is. (Level 1)
Answers: leading edge flaps.
trailing edge flaps.
C. spoiler.

Questions.QuestionString: Large flap deployment. (Level 1)
Answers: causes increased spanwise flow towards tips on wing upper surface.
causes increased spanwise flow towards tips on wing lower surface.
C. has no effect on spanwise flow.

Questions.QuestionString: What type of flap is this?. (Level 1)
Answers: Split flap.
Plain flap.
C. Fowler flap.

Questions.QuestionString: Air above Mach 0.7 is. (Level 1)
Answers: compressible only when above the speed of sound.
incompressible.
C. compressible.

Questions.QuestionString: Shock stall. (Level 1)
Answers: occurs at high speeds.
is a flap down stall and occurs at high speeds.
C. occurs at low speeds.

Questions.QuestionString: As you approach supersonic speed. (Level 1)
Answers: thrust is reduced.
total drag is increased.
C. lift is reduced.

Questions.QuestionString: Mach trim in some aircraft assists. (Level 1)
Answers: lateral stability.
vertical stability.
C. longitudinal stability.

Questions.QuestionString: Before an aircraft reaches critical mach. (Level 1)
Answers: the nose pitches up because the CP moves Forward.
the aircraft buffets because the CP moves to the shock wave.
C. the nose pitches down because the CP moves rear.

Questions.QuestionString: Flaps at landing position. (Level 1)
Answers: decrease landing speed.
decrease take off and landing speeds.
C. decrease take off speed.

Questions.QuestionString: Supersonic air going through an incipient shock wave will decrease its speed and. (Level 1)
Answers: decrease temperature and increase density.
increase temperature and decrease density.
C. increase temperature and increase density.

Questions.QuestionString: An increase in mach number will cause the. (Level 1)
Answers: CofP to move rearwards giving more downwash on the tail plane.
CofP to move forwards giving less downwash on the tail plane.
C. CofP to move rearwards giving less downwash on the tail plane.

Questions.QuestionString: Mach trim counters. (Level 1)
Answers: longitudinal instability.
vertical instability.
C. lateral instability.

Questions.QuestionString: At high Mach Numbers above Mach 2.2, some aircraft metals. (Level 1)
Answers: such as aluminium, become brittle.
lose their strength due to the kinetic heating effect.
C. will shrink due to the extreme pressures involved.

Questions.QuestionString: Mach trim operates. (Level 1)
Answers: along the longitudinal axis.
along the lateral axis.
C. to reduce Dutch roll.

Questions.QuestionString: To increase critical mach number. (Level 1)
Answers: the wings are swept.
elevons are fitted.
C. tailerons are fitted.

Questions.QuestionString: A Mach Trimmer is a device which. (Level 1)
Answers: prevents the aircraft from exceeding its critical Mach No.
automatically compensates for trim changes in the transonic region.
C. switches out trim control to prevent damage in the transonic speed range.

Questions.QuestionString: The angle of attack of a blade is the. (Level 1)
Answers: angle between the spin axis and relative air flow.
angle between the chord line and plane of rotation.
C. angle between the chord line and relative airflow.

Questions.QuestionString: On a helicopter, what is blade dragging?. (Level 1)
Answers: Movement of each blade vertically about their lateral hinges.
Contact of the blade tips on the ground.
C. Movement of each blade horizontally about their vertical hinge.

Questions.QuestionString: As a subsonic aircraft speeds-up, its Centre of Pressure. (Level 1)
Answers: moves aft.
moves forward.
C. is unaffected.

Questions.QuestionString: Lift generated by a blade is proportional to the. (Level 1)
Answers: relative airflow and the pitch.
aircraft airspeed and angle of attack.
C. relative airflow and the angle of attack.

Questions.QuestionString: Relative velocity of a helicopter rotor. (Level 1)
Answers: increases at forward travelling blade.
is equal for all blades.
C. increases at retreating blade.

Questions.QuestionString: Assuming the phase lag of a rotor blade is 90 degree and the control advance angle is 15 degrees, then the pitch operating arm must be at the highest point of the swash plate:. (Level 1)
Answers: 90 degree ahead of the highest flapping position.
75 degree ahead of the highest flapping position.
C. 105 degree ahead of the highest flapping position.

Questions.QuestionString: A helicopter is hovering and the pilot applies right pedal.Assuming the main rotor rotates anti clockwise viewed from above, the helicopter will. (Level 1)
Answers: descend, unless the pilot inches the throttle open.
ascend, unless the pilot decreases rotor RPM.
C. descend, unless the pilot applies more collective pitch.

Questions.QuestionString: The tail rotor. (Level 1)
Answers: produces a force opposing torque reaction.
produces a force in the same direction as torque reaction.
C. is not subject to dissymmetry of lift.

Questions.QuestionString: Certain helicopters tend to tilt laterally when landing. This problem can be overcome by placing the tail rotor thrust. (Level 1)
Answers: below the line of the main rotor hub.
above the line of the main rotor hub.
C. in line with the main rotor hub.

Questions.QuestionString: Lowering of the flaps. (Level 1)
Answers: increases drag.
increases lift.
C. increases drag and lift.

Questions.QuestionString: What do ruddervators do?. (Level 1)
Answers: Control yaw and roll.
Control pitch and yaw.
C. Control pitch and roll.

Questions.QuestionString: What does a trim tab do?. (Level 1)
Answers: Allows the CofG to be outside the normal limit.
Provides finer control movements by the pilot.
C. Eases control loading for pilot.

Questions.QuestionString: How does a balance tab move?. (Level 1)
Answers: In the same direction a small amount.
In the opposite direction proportional to the control surface it is attached to.
C. In the same direction proportional to the control surface it is attached to.

Questions.QuestionString: An aircraft left wing is flying low. The aileron trimmer control to the left aileron trim tab in the cockpit would be. (Level 1)
Answers: moved up causing the left aileron to move up.
moved up causing the left aileron to move down.
C. moved down causing the left aileron to move down.

Questions.QuestionString: An elevator tab moves down. (Level 1)
Answers: to make the nose go down.
to counteract for the aircraft flying nose heavy.
C. to counteract for the aircraft flying tail heavy.
